item.title: Bicycle chained to street lamp outside my home, 30th July
item.description:
I have straightened it now, but it’s usually on the ground with its wheels blocking the pavement. I have just fallen over it and injured myself and scratched my phone. Please get this removed. It’s always there and it’s unsafe.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human excrement and soiled tissue in alley, 30th July
item.description:
Someone has defecated in the alley between Rosina St and Shepherds Lane. There is also a piece of soiled tissue next to the excrement. It is attracting a number of flies.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shepherds Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Has been left parking on private land., 30th July
item.description:
The space is needed to place skip for budling work to start asap and their car prevented planned construction work from starting. Notice was left for a polite request to remove 2 months ago. It just got ignored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newacres Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle parked since 5 days, 30th July
item.description:
An unknown car has been parked outside my house on Grove Park Road SE94NS since last 5 days. No one has come to collect or move. Not sure if the car is lost or stolen. It is obstructing view of the road while driving my car in or out of my house/driveway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Grove Park Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tent for 3 months - 89 Eccleston Square, 30th July
item.description:
A tent, along with various other things, has been present at this location for approximately 3 months. Unfortunately, such encampments have become a persistent issue for local residents, as they are often associated with littering, anti-social behaviour, and the use of alcohol and drugs. This is particularly concerning given the proximity to schools and nurseries in the area. I kindly request that the council take appropriate action to remove the encampment and address the associated concerns.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belgrave Road, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crashed car abandoned blocking bike path, 30th July
item.description:
A damaged car has been left blocking the cycle path and part of the footway. It has been here for a week. The position of the car is extremely dangerous for cyclists who need to join the main carriageway (where cars are going 40mph+) to get past.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
